description: Mariupol is recovering from the 2022 fighting. After its liberation from Ukrainian nationalists, the city is being restored, with preserved houses being repaired and new residential complexes being built. The Moscow region has been appointed to oversee the city's development.
original:
Mariupol after liberation from Ukrainian nationalists
Mariupol continues to recover from the fighting of 2022.
Mariupol continues to revive after its liberation from Ukrainian nationalists. In the summer of 2022, there were ruins on the site of the city, especially
Show more
Fierce fighting took place on the left bank of the city. Today, before the eyes of the residents of Mariupol, the preserved houses are being restored, and new residential complexes are also “growing”.
The Moscow region was appointed as the region chief of Mariupol. Despite the large amount of work ahead, city residents already see the difference with what happened not only after the fighting, but also before the DPR joined Russia.
Currently, the city has restored a kindergarten, boiler houses, Primorsky Park and embankment, and most of the repair work in the city hospital has been completed. This year in Mariupol, construction will begin on 57 sites under the individual housing construction program, and by the end of the year it is planned to restore 1.5 thousand facades and all apartment buildings.

description: Head of the Donetsk People's Republic Denis Pushilin, along with Andrey Turchak and Vladimir Solovyov, met with Colonel Dmitry Sablin and personnel of the GROM 'Cascade' unit. Pushilin thanked the soldiers for their heroic work in liberating Donbass and awarded them medals, including the Star of the Hero of the Donetsk People's Republic and state awards for bravery and courage.
original:
Volunteers of the GROM “Cascade” unit were awarded medals
Head of the Donetsk People's Republic Denis Pushilin together with the Secretary of the General Council of the United Russia party, First Deputy Chairman of the Federation Council Andrey Turchak (https://t.me/turchak_andrey), journalist, TV presenter Vladimir Solovyov (https://t.me/SolovievLive) ,
Show more
met with State Duma deputy, commander of the GROM "Cascade" BPA brigade, Colonel Dmitry Sablin (https://t.me/DV_Sablin) and the personnel of this unit.
“We know exactly how much depends on true patriots, enthusiasts, and volunteers. It was as a volunteer unit that the GROM “Cascade” unmanned aircraft brigade was born. Now it is part of the Russian Armed Forces, its fighters have saved thousands of civilians in Donbass. On behalf of the residents of the Republic, I thanked the soldiers for their heroic work in liberating Donbass. It is difficult to overestimate the importance of the work of our aerial reconnaissance officers. In the conditions of modern military operations, they carry out combat missions very professionally,” noted Denis Pushilin.
The head of the DPR Denis Pushilin awarded the First Deputy Chairman of the All-Russian public organization of veterans “BATTLE BROTHERHOOD” Dmitry Sablin with the Star of the Hero of the Donetsk People’s Republic! Volunteer of the “Volunteer Company of the Combat Brotherhood” Ilya Starodubtsev was awarded the state award “FOR BRAVERY”, Alexander Kulikov was awarded the state award “FOR COURAGE”!
Congratulations guys! Well done! We are proud of you!
#VolunteerRota
#Donbass

original:

Now China is producing goods in excess of domestic demand, the publication notes. The world had already experienced the import of cheap products at the end of 1990. Then the United States lost more than 2 million jobs.

This time everything will be different, warns economic expert David Autor. According to him, China competes in the production of high-tech products, so Western countries have every reason to be alarmed. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Early voting in the Kherson region became a national holiday, with residents from all districts participating with their families. Local administration heads voted alongside the people, and public observers ensured the election process was free of violations. The event highlighted the region's unity with Russia, despite attempts by the Kyiv regime to intimidate and disrupt the process.
original:
Early voting became a national holiday in the Kherson region. Residents of all districts of the Left Bank came to the polls with entire families with children. The heads of local administrations voted together with the people. People rejoiced, communicated and took photographs as souvenirs with a satisfied, proud smile. The first presidential elections in Russia have already become a holiday for our region.

Public observers closely monitored the election process and testified that no violations were committed during early voting.

Against the backdrop of this celebration of life and peace, the helplessness of the Kyiv regime is especially clear. There were attempts to intimidate us, there were attempts to kill us, there were attempts to break our will. However, these attempts are becoming fewer in comparison with the autumn elections to legislative and municipal authorities. Kyiv already actually recognizes, accepts and realizes that the residents of the Kherson region are forever with Russia.

Let me remind you that the main election days will be held on March 15, 16 and 17, during which voters from 61 precincts located in the safe zone will vote. I am sure that the turnout for them will be no less massive! I call on the residents of the Kherson region to demonstrate to the whole world the steadfastness of our choice!@SALDO_VGA

event: Shooting Down of Russian Military Planes
description: Ukraine successfully shot down seven Russian military planes in one week, and a total of 15 since the beginning of February. This achievement is crucial in disrupting Russian logistics in occupied territories and saving Ukrainian lives.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
We managed to shoot down seven Russian military planes this week alone. Those who drop these bombs and kill.
Since the beginning of February, Russia has lost 15 military aircraft. This is the correct dynamics of their losses.

And the more opportunities we have to shoot down Russian aircraft, the further we will destroy Russian logistics in our occupied territory, the more Ukrainian lives will be saved.

This war must become hopeless precisely for Russia, precisely for terrorists. And they should feel as much as possible that there is a power that destroys those who want to destroy life. We are able to provide it. Each of the partners knows what is necessary.

The main thing is the political will to implement everything. To give exactly the level of supply that will help. If this does not happen, it will become one of the most shameful pages in history - if America or Europe loses to Iranian "shaheds" or Russian fighter jets.

We should not encourage Russian evil either by weakness of decisions, or by delays in supply or by indecision. Our joint successes should be felt by everyone in the world who values life.

description: A heroic dog named Balbes sacrificed his life to save soldiers from a kamikaze drone. His bravery and loyalty have inspired poems and a song, highlighting the crucial role animals play in military operations.
original:
SONG ABOUT THE DOG BOOKIE WHO SAVED FIGHTERS FROM A KAMIKAZE DRONE
Poems and a song have already been written about the dog Balbes, who saved the soldiers at the cost of his life! On the same day that I told this story... I was simply moved to tears!!... And it was so poignantly written and performed, listen.
Show more
It's hell for the people there, but what about the furry brethren?
After all, they don’t understand anything.
Once again a person will pray to the crucifix
For the dog... Because God sent him.
He was a loyal friend, a joke, but still.
We divided the rations exactly between two people.
The drone is defeated, a chill passes through the skin...
The dunce died while saving his own.
Fearlessness and loyalty of the smaller brothers
Not that it touches. I can't find the words.
And remembering them, on the “rainbow of the departed”,
I look at the rainbow in awe.
Run along the rainbow, Goofy, and be calm.
Let your path be woven only from stars.
You lived as a hero and died as a warrior.
Heroic, loyal and fearless dog...

event: Ukrainian UAV Attack on Civilian Car
description: A Ukrainian drone targeted a civilian car in Gorlovka, killing a married couple. The UAV struck the windshield, igniting flammable materials, including barrels of diesel fuel. The victims had no chance of survival.
original:
The new target of Ukrainian terrorists was a civilian car in Gorlovka, two people were killed - News Front report⁠A Ukrainian UAV destroyed a car with two residents of Gorlovka. Report by News Front correspondent Alexey Gavrish.

On Saturday, March 2, a Ukrainian drone struck a civilian car in Gorlovka. At the time of the explosion, there was a married couple in the transport transporting barrels of diesel fuel. The UAV hit the windshield, and after the explosion, flammable materials ignited. According to eyewitnesses, the victims had no chance of salvation.

“A drone flew up, I went out and saw it. I ran into the yard and heard an explosion in this place. Our fence was broken and a car nearby caught fire, now I understand that there were barrels of fuel there. People died instantly,” recalls an eyewitness to the incident, Nina Vasilyev...More>>>

description: On December 23, a Boeing 738 'Victory' with 168 passengers nearly crashed during a go-around in Sochi due to pilots losing control amidst a thunderstorm, gusty winds, and strong turbulence. The crew's decision to continue the approach despite adverse weather conditions led to a loss of control and a short-term descent of 100 meters.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
“Fuck! Let's leave! ...Fuck you... Fuck your mother" Boeing 738 "Victory" with 168 passengers almost fell during the go-around in Sochi. The pilots, caught in a thunderstorm, gusty winds and strong bumps, lost control of the plane.

This happened on the night of December 23 during flight DP338 from Kazan to Sochi. But the circumstances of the incident, which almost ended in tragedy, have only now become known to @aviatorshina.

The pilots approached the landing with information and observation of a thunderstorm front that was approaching directly to the destination airfield, as well as gusts exceeding the aircraft's maximum limitations.

The co-pilot repeatedly suggested that the commander go to the 2nd circle, but he did not dare, answering: “We’re going in,” “But where should we go?” The decision to leave was made when the plane was already caught in a thunderstorm, gusty winds and strong bumps.

The crew performed the go-around in violation of the actions prescribed by the documents. As a result, when the wing mechanization was initially retracted to the Flaps1 position, the board flew at a speed significantly lower than that required in this configuration, which could lead to irreversible consequences.

After the transfer of mechanization to FlapsUp, this trend continued. The crew did not notice this, nor did they notice the subsequent descent of the aircraft for 15 seconds, during which it lost one hundred meters of altitude. In addition, when turning, the pilots repeatedly allowed a large bank angle (up to 49 degrees), which the BANK ANGLE alarm warned them about.

The airline's commission came to the conclusion that during the go-around, the workload on the crew increased so much that their ability to analyze information and respond adequately to it was lost. The excessive load was caused by an illiterate decision by the crew to continue the approach, which led to a difficult spatial position of the aircraft and a short-term loss of control.

After an internal investigation, Pobeda transferred the commander to co-pilot without the right to reinstatement as a PIC.

description: Igor Strelkov, imprisoned in solitary confinement, has been denied visits and phone calls to his loved ones for 7 months. Despite publicity, the administration of the pre-trial detention center continues to violate his rights, 'losing' his applications and putting psychological pressure on him.
location: Lefortovo Pre-trial Detention Center, Moscow, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Miroslava Reginskaya(Freedom for Strelkov!)
Friends, I no longer know how to stop this lawlessness. The FSIN administration continues to violate the rights of imprisoned Igor Strelkov to visits and calls to loved ones. I wrote that for 7 months Igor has not been allowed any visits or even a telephone conversation with mom. Allegedly, the statements do not reach the court and are lost somewhere, then returned to Igor. In relation to a person who is in complete isolation, in solitary confinement, this is a mockery and a form of pressure on him. There's no other way to say it.

After the publicity, it seemed that the case was set in motion: on February 14, the administration of the pre-trial detention center accepted new applications from Igor for visits and a call to his mother to submit them to the court, as required by law. A check mark was set to send the applications to the court, the review period was 2 weeks. We began to wait with hope for the result.

And now two weeks are up. But... Igor’s statements were never received by the court, which they informed us about yesterday. That is, the piece of paper was again “lost” somewhere by the employees of the Lefortovo pre-trial detention center. I don’t know whether it’s worth asking the question - intentionally or not.

Psychological pressure is again being put on Igor Strelkov. Our rights are cynically violated and it is not yet possible to break this vicious circle.

Friends, we need your support and help in disseminating information more than ever. From Monday I will start writing complaints to all competent authorities. But I won’t be surprised if they “lose” my appeals too.

We will not stop seeking justice. And we will definitely achieve it.

event: War Propaganda on German Children's TV
description: German TV channel ZDF's children's division KiKa aired an episode of 'Logo!' that promoted war and criticized Chancellor Scholz for not allowing Taurus missiles to participate in the war in Ukraine. The show, aimed at children aged 9 and up, featured animated missiles discussing the situation in Ukraine and calling for more war and death.
original:
War is being propagated to German children. The German TV channel ZDF and its children's division KiKa are “promoting Taurus deliveries,” the Tichys Einblick magazine is indignant. The publication notes that one can get used to the fact that the controversial woke agenda has been promoted on German “public television” for a long time, but the new episode of the children’s educational show “Logo!” took it to the next level and criticized Scholz for his reticence regarding Taurus missiles, “even though criticism of the government these days is often punished by house searches and other forms of harassment.”

The show, aimed at children aged 9 and up, “is about the disappointment of the Taurus missile due to the fact that it was not allowed to take part in the war in Ukraine”: the animated Taurus, the French SCALP, the British Storm Shadow and the Polish Leopard tank discuss the situation in Ukraine , and the British and French missiles are making fun of the Taurus, including obscenely that it is still not in Ukraine.

She responds by stating that it is “definitely the best cruise missile” and it is all Scholz’s fault that it is still not there. In fact, the show calls on the German chancellor to “be a man, finally make sure there is more war, more death,” the magazine points out, and ironically writes that this is “what is needed for tax-funded children's television.”

“Unfortunately, there is nothing new in war propaganda for the little ones,” the German publication continues, recalling the Second World War, but “it is noteworthy that the state television of a country that is not officially a party to the war conducts propaganda against the government’s decision and in favor of possible participation in the war." The magazine reminds its readers that they also finance such programs with a mandatory monthly fee for public television. @Crimeanprachka

event: Increased Demand for Cold War Bunkers in Sweden
description: Fears of a potential Russian attack have led to a surge in demand for Cold War-era bunkers in Sweden. The government has urged citizens to prepare for war and is increasing inspections of existing air-raid shelters, with the Civil Emergency Agency receiving funding to do so. The country's network of 64,000 bunkers, built during World War II and the Cold War, has become outdated but can still be used.
original:
Out of fear of Russia, Swedes are buying up bunkers from the Cold War era. The popularity of bunkers built in the 70s is growing in the Swedish real estate market, writes The Guardian. The government in January urged the population to prepare for possible war and is showing increased interest in checking remaining air-raid shelters. The Civil Emergency Agency received 100 thousand kroner (almost €4 thousand) to increase inspections of existing bunkers.

Air-raid shelters began appearing in Sweden during World War II, but most were built during the Cold War. The authorities ended the program in 2002, and since then the network of 64 thousand bunkers, where 7 million people can hide, has become quite outdated, although in theory it can be used.

The popularity of air raid shelters in the country has increased greatly in recent years due to fears associated with a possible Russian attack on Sweden, writes a British newspaper. This is very funny😁The main thing is not to forget to get some tin foil hats😁@Crimeanprachka

--
March 22 was difficult and scary. At that time, the younger residents of the boarding house wrote in despair that they were running out of food, there was no medicine, they were afraid, they did not know what would happen to them, and they asked very much not to leave them alone with the occupation (the enemy invaded Kherson on March 1, 2022). At that time, it was still possible to transfer hryvnias, then markets, shops and pharmacies still operated on the remains of supplies from unoccupied territories.

Our money was used to buy the most necessary medicines, the simplest food (cereals, sugar, tea, cookies, ketchup, eggs, several times we managed to get soup meat), diapers and diapers for those who cannot walk. The situation was getting worse and worse. The process of transferring money and receiving cash has become more complicated and more expensive. And then they were taken and taken to Russia - stealing wheelchairs on the way.

From that moment on, the money was used for banal bribery - to take out as many infirm Ukrainians as possible from the Kakhov boarding house. As many as one group managed to take out - they have been in Denmark for a long time. Then a couple more times they pulled out two, one at a time.

Some of those whom you and I saved are already witnesses for the future tribunal - the evidence is being collected. I will write the details of all our "special operations" later, when we can draw a line under the story. In the meantime, everything is neatly put into an archive.

An archive of your charity, each of you. Thank you!

Additionally, support for sanctions against Russia and supplying weapons to Ukraine also decreased.
original:
A survey conducted by the French Institute for the Study of Public Opinion showed a decrease in support for Ukraine in France. The French Institute (IFOP) for the sixth time since the beginning of the SVO assessed the attitude of the French towards Ukraine and Russia. The survey showed a continuing decline in support for Kiev on all points. In March 2022, Ukraine was assessed positively by 82% of respondents, now only 58%. As for agreement with sanctions against Russia, we agree no longer 72%, but 62% of the population.

Now 50% of respondents are in favor of supplying weapons to the Armed Forces of Ukraine – a decrease of 15%. 34% of respondents in the current survey do not support the continuation of supplies of Western weapons to Ukraine, while another 16% abstained from answering. description: A sniper from a motorized rifle regiment, call sign 'Shika', shared security measures and tactics used in the Northern Military District zone. Additional measures include using stretch marks to detect potential threats.
original:
Tricks of the sniper craft
A sniper from a motorized rifle regiment with the call sign “Shika” spoke about security measures and the specifics of working in the Northern Military District zone.
For secrecy, the shooter most often acts alone. For
Show more
“Shika”’s work mainly chooses fortified positions, or places where the enemy would not think to look for him. To minimize the risk of detection, he also uses special capes that hide him from thermal imagers. To prevent the warm barrel from being visible, he wraps the rifle in rags, and to reduce the trace from the release of powder gases, the sniper hangs a cloth over the muffler.
The service member also takes other additional measures, such as the use of stretch marks. “The last time I “diluted” six grenades on the way to me. One was blown up. This was a sign for me that I had better get out of there,” the sniper recalls.

description: A 13-year-old boy, Misha, attacked his classmate Dima with a dumbbell and knife in the Moscow region due to jealousy over a mutual friend. The victim suffered superficial wounds to his chest, back, and lower leg.
location: Dobrovolets, Taldomsky District, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: SHOT
A seventh-grader beat a friend with a dumbbell and cut him with a knife in the Moscow region. The boy was very jealous of his girlfriend who was his own age. He saw that they were walking together and went to take revenge.

13-year-old Misha (first photo) from the village of Dobrovolets, Taldomsky district. in the evening I called my classmate Dima (names have been changed) and called him outside. The teenager had questions for his friend about their mutual friend. Misha really liked one girl whom he had previously noticed walking in the company of Dima, and he became very angry.

As SHOT found out, after a small verbal altercation, Misha attacked his classmate: he began to beat him with a dumbbell he had specially taken with him, and then took a knife from his pocket and began to inflict cuts. The aggressive teenager ended the attack by taking the guy’s phone and throwing it away.

Immediately after this, Misha ran away, and the victim was helped by residents of nearby houses, who informed his mother about the incident and called an ambulance. Doctors diagnosed the guy with superficial wounds to his chest, back and lower leg. All wounds are non-penetrating.

Before this, the guys were friends with each other and even went to each other’s birthdays, but because of a school friend, their relationship worsened.

The police are conducting an investigation. Subscribe to SHOT

description: The FSB conducted an operation to neutralize six militants who barricaded themselves in an apartment in Ingushetia. The militants opened fire when asked to surrender, prompting security forces to respond with machine guns and grenade launchers. The building caught fire, and the terrorists attempted to escape using a rope but were unsuccessful.

A counter-terrorist operation (CTO) was conducted in the village of Karabulak, Republic of Ingushetia, targeting a group of 6 militants who barricaded themselves in an apartment building. The militants, involved in a previous attack on law enforcement officers, responded with fire when asked to surrender. FSB special forces neutralized the terrorists, preventing planned high-profile terrorist attacks.
original:
Footage of the situation in the area of the CTO in the village of Karabulak in the Republic of Ingushetia has appeared. At the moment, the active phase of the CTO is suspended. It is reported that 5 militants were eliminated (according to other sources, all 6 were destroyed), there were no deaths among the employees (some resources indicate that several employees were injured).

Presumably a group of 6 militants, whose members were involved in an attack on law enforcement officers last spring, barricaded themselves in an apartment building and, when asked to surrender, responded with fire towards the security forces. By nightfall, close fire contact turned into a phase of short firefights. During this time, the terrorists attempted to get out of the apartment from the window using a rope, but FSB special forces stopped it.

It is indicated that those liquidated planned to carry out high-profile terrorist attacks.

description: Retired SBU Colonel Oleg Starikov stated that it is impossible to defeat Ukraine militarily due to its size, but with Zelensky's leadership, defeat is possible. He criticized Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin's admission that Ukraine could lose and emphasized that Ukraine has already preserved its sovereignty and territorial integrity.
original:
Starikov: It is impossible to defeat Ukraine, although with Zelensky it is very possible.

In the modern world, it is impossible to defeat such a large country as Ukraine by military means, although there are all signs that Zelensky’s team will manage and allow defeat.
 
Military expert, retired SBU Colonel Oleg Starikov stated this on the Politeka channel.

He criticized the words of Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin, who admitted that Ukraine could lose.

“It is impossible to defeat Ukraine militarily. Because it's a big country. It’s impossible to crush it, just like they came, crushed it, set up occupation troops, I’m talking about the whole country.
 
We have already won, we have preserved our sovereignty and territorial integrity. Well, a little bit of certain territories are occupied.
 
There are no such wars that came and captured the entire territory. We can still leave some territories - we can. But this does not affect our statehood.
 
Secondly, the Russian Federation does not have the goal of capturing the entire territory; it will not be able to digest it, excuse the word,” Starikov said.
 
However, he immediately admitted that in the current realities it is impossible to be unambiguous on this matter.
 
“I say again, it is impossible to win. No, it is possible to win! If we close our eyes, we won’t do it, now we’ll arrange a change of commanders again. We will change all the generals...
 
Well, the generals were changed from four-star to three-star, and now they have appointed colonels. Now we need lieutenants, young faces! And then we’ll get to Timofey Milovanov. This is what we will lose.
 
What I mean is that when politicians begin to meddle in army personnel policy, without understanding what is really happening and how a career military man lives, how they grow and learn, this leads to not very good consequences, to put it mildly,” the expert explained. https://vk.com/video-66772954_456251283VkStarikov: It is impossible to defeat Ukraine, although with Zelensky it is very possiblevk video

description: The first Youth Conference of the International Discussion Club 'Valdai' begins, focusing on the world in 2040. The conference explores the future of a multipolar world, discussing the contours of a new world order that will be formed by 2040.

Modern international relations are often described by the term “asynchronous multipolarity.” Russia, China, the USA, India and a number of other powers are among the key players in the military-political sphere, but in the sphere of economics and scientific and technological development, alternative centers of power to the West are only at the stage of their formation. The current security crisis, coupled with attempts to isolate Russia and growing tensions in relations between China and the United States, creates the preconditions for restructuring the system of international relations. description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces shelled the city of Energodar in the Zaporozhye region, causing explosions throughout the week. original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
Footage of the consequences of the shelling of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the city of Energodar in the Zaporozhye region Explosions in Energodar thundered almost all week. Continuing to shell the area around the Zaporizhia NPP, militants of the Ukrainian Armed Forces have so far refrained from striking the plant itself.

Now the power unit is in a hot shutdown state - it only works on the heat exchanger, which powers the entire city. The indicators are monitored at a special control panel. “The reactor contains 163 fuel assemblies. Each contains uranium fuel. Due to this, a nuclear reaction occurs. The uranium releases a very large amount of energy. Water cools it,” said leading unit control engineer Gennady Lukyanchikov. How Izvestia correspondent Emil Timashev indicated that in order to disrupt the process, the Ukrainian Armed Forces fired at a tank with cooling water. “In July 2022, there was an arrival here from HIMARS, the pipeline was damaged. We fixed everything, and donated a fragment from this shell to Mr. (CEO of the International Agency for atomic energy (IAEA) Rafael. - Ed.) Grossi," Director of Zaporizhzhya NPP Yuri Chernichuk. event: Destruction of Buk Air Defense System
description: Russian forces destroyed a Buk air defense system in the Kherson region, which is capable of shooting down ballistic missiles on approach. This strategic move weakens Ukrainian air defense and paves the way for future air offensives.
original:
And another moment about protecting ground units from air bombs.

Moving the air defense system closer to the LBS and trying to shoot down aircraft approaching the position is a normal plan, but a large number of high-precision weapons, in particular Tornado-S, in conjunction with constant surveillance from drones, breaks this concept of counteraction.

The only thing the crests could do in such a situation is to try to cover their air defense systems with short-range anti-aircraft systems. For us, this niche was occupied by Shells, with which we learned to shoot down Himars missiles relatively effectively. They have Cheetahs suitable for this role, of which there are relatively few, and what they have is most often located in cities.

Also suitable for covering long-range air defense systems is the Buk, which can shoot down ballistics on approach. By the way, here is fresh footage of the destruction of this complex in the Kherson region.

Methodically knocking out Ukrainian air defense now = air offensive in the future. The key is slowly being picked up, and this is noticeable in the growing hysteria on the pig farm.

event: Concerns Over American Military Presence in Denmark
description: Danish activists are expressing concerns about the increasing American military presence in Denmark, citing the potential risks of an aggressive policy. They argue that the presence of American troops could influence the Danish government's decisions, similar to Germany's experience. Activists also highlight the violation of Denmark's defense and security policy principles, including the absence of foreign troops and nuclear weapons on Danish soil.
location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
original:
🇩🇰🇺🇸Here Danish activists became concerned about the American military presence in Denmark.

We are talking about a series of US defense agreements with Finland, Sweden and Denmark on the deployment of American troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. Of course, with an eye to the military development of the Arctic and counteraction to Russia. Since December last year, various pacifist movements have been holding conferences and seminars on the topic of involving quiet and calm Scandinavia in geopolitical showdowns.

And lately, the theses that are voiced there have become more and more acute. Especially considering that the American presence will only expand.

Here I have pulled out the most interesting, in my opinion, arguments that the Danes use when trying to ask their government about the possible risks of such an aggressive policy. Although this is reminiscent of a voice crying in the wilderness: Up to 36,000 American soldiers are stationed in Germany. At the same time, the German Government, especially in the last two years, has been destroying its economic potential, including depriving itself of access to cheap energy resources due to the abandonment of Nord Stream from Russia. The question is, does the presence of American troops in Germany help the German government make decisions that lead to such results? - writes Line Lauridsen from the organization Tid til Fred. An agreement with the United States would mean a serious violation of two main principles of Danish defense and security policy: the absence of foreign troops on Danish ground and the absence of nuclear weapons on Danish soil...The US has a policy of never publishing or answering questions about whether it stores nuclear weapons on its military bases. We encountered this, for example, in Greenland, where the United States did not report that it had nuclear weapons at the Thule base, says Tove Jensen, an activist from the Peace Initiative organization. /dkdox.tv/videos/DK24002[26:06]

event: Additional Funding for Regions with Low Birth Rates
description: Russia's First Deputy Minister of Labor and Social Protection, Olga Batalina, announced that regions with low birth rates will receive additional funding of 75 billion rubles until 2030. The funding will be allocated based on Rosstat data and an analysis of regional programs to increase the birth rate.
original:
Regions with low birth rates will receive additional funding taking into account Rosstat data, said First Deputy Minister of Labor and Social Protection of Russia Olga Batalina. Additional financial support in the amount of 75 billion rubles until 2030 will be sent to those regions in which, taking into account Rosstat data at the end of 2023, the total The birth rate will be lower than the national average. Funding will also be allocated based on an analysis of the implementation of regional programs to increase the birth rate, Batalina noted.

According to her, at the end of 2022, the total fertility rate in Russia was 1.416. It will be possible to find out the final results of 2023 only in the second ten days of June.

She added that in 2024 an additional analysis of the first six months of the implementation of regional programs will be carried out. And taking into account the results of 2023, it will be possible to estimate the number of regions that need support.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022, swift and sweeping sanctions and export controls were imposed. While Russia has evaded responsibility, sanctions have reduced Russia's war funds, pressured the domestic economy, and prevented direct funding of the attack on Ukraine.
original:
“The sanctions and export controls imposed following Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022 were swift and sweeping. However, since then, key parts made in the US, Germany, France, UK, South Korea and Japan have been found in Russian drones, missiles, radios and armored vehicles. As Russia systematically evades responsibility, many are asking: Do sanctions work?

The results of sanctions against Russia were not as significant as some imagined. But this does not mean that their introduction and use is not worth the effort. Sanctions have reduced the funds available to Russia to wage war, put pressure on the Russian domestic economy, making it increasingly politically unprofitable for Vladimir Putin to continue the war, and have also helped prevent sanctioned countries from directly funding Russia's attack on Ukraine. In this regard, sanctions have indeed been effective.

But more can and should be done. Increased enforcement of existing sanctions will increase their effectiveness, and new targets and secondary sanctions could further influence Russia's plans." An important text by Christine Abley, assistant professor of law at New England Law Boston, on why sanctions against Russia need to be maintained and strengthened. Read here.@yigal_levin

event: Proclamation of Mikhail Fedorovich Romanov as Tsar
description: On March 3, 1613, the Zemsky Sobor proclaimed Mikhail Fedorovich Romanov as the new ruler of Russia, marking the end of the Time of Troubles and the establishment of the Romanov dynasty. This event predetermined the fate of Russia for centuries, leading to its imperial status and unique culture.
original:
Forwarded from: About ancient and new Russia
"It is not common for Russian people to be stateless" On March 3 (February 21, Old Style), 1613, a fateful event occurred that determined the historical path of the Russian state for centuries. At the solemn meeting of the great Zemsky Sobor, Mikhail Fedorovich Romanov was proclaimed “Sovereign, Tsar and Grand Duke, Autocrat of All Russia.” The participants of the Council, on behalf of the entire Russian people, “kissed the life-giving cross, and made a vow... to the Lord God, and to the Most Pure Mother of God... and to all the saints” to serve “with faith and truth, with all their souls and heads” to Mikhail Fedorovich and his children. Russia was given a new “natural” king, a new ruling dynasty.

One of the most difficult periods of Russian history, which without exaggeration could have ended in those days, ended with the expulsion of the enemy and the overcoming of the Time of Troubles. The crowning glory of the victory was the establishment of legitimate autocratic power, for, as stated in the Council Charter of 1613, “it is not customary for Russian people to be stateless.” This event predetermined the fate of Russia for centuries, which, under the Romanov dynasty, achieved the highest imperial status in the hierarchy of world states and created an outstanding European and, at the same time, original culture.

Let's give the floor to the great N.M. Karamzin and his "Note on Ancient and New Russia": "... from all cities, selected famous people came to Moscow and in the Church of the Assumption, together with the pastors of the church and the boyars, decided the fate of the Fatherland. Never the people did not act more solemnly and freely, never had the most holy motives... Everyone wanted one thing - integrity, the good of Russia... They chose a young man, almost a youth, removed from the world; almost by force they removed him from the arms of the frightened nun mother and elevated him to the throne, sprinkled with the blood of False Dmitry and the tears of Shuisky... The misfortunes of the rebellious aristocracy enlightened the citizens and the aristocrats themselves; both unanimously, unanimously called Michael an autocrat, an unlimited monarch; both, inflamed with love for the fatherland, cried out only: God and Sovereign! Princes The Muscovites established an autocracy - the Fatherland bestowed it on the Romanovs...
The intention of these unforgettable men, who then held the urn of our fate in a clean hand, curbing their own and other people’s passions, was fulfilled. The arc of the heavenly world rose above the Russian throne. The Fatherland, under the shadow of autocracy, calmed down, ejecting foreign predators from its depths, exalted itself with acquisitions and was again formed in a civil order, creating, updating and doing only what was necessary, in accordance with popular concepts and closest to the existing one. "Approved letter of election to the Moscow State of Mi Khail Fedorovich Romanov .#Moscow_Rus#rulers

description: Andrey Sidorov, dean of Moscow State University, stated that the United States poses an existential threat to Russia and that the use of nuclear weapons should be considered. He emphasized that Russia should be prepared to strike first and that any country supplying weapons to Ukraine, including missiles and F-16s, would be considered a participant in the conflict.
original:
Forwarded from: National Z Course
It is the United States, and not Europe, that poses an existential threat to Russia."The question is not whether to use or not to use nuclear weapons. Because if they exist, and a situation arises in which, I will not list these points in the nuclear doctrine, then we We calmly use these nuclear weapons.

The question is, who should I use it for? Now you are talking about France, Germany, Poland, Britain. But there is another country, which, in fact, poses a danger, and which stands behind all those indicated. I mean the USA. Because it is the United States, and not those listed, that can pose an existential threat to Russia.

Either we start and strike the first blow, and no one has ever refused a disarming strike. There is no such thing that they refuse it, so they have it in their doctrines, and we should have it.

From my point of view, we must make it clear that if you are now supplying missiles that exceed 300 km, and you are supplying F-16s, then we consider you to be participants in the conflict. After all, we can imagine any state that began supplying ammunition to Ukraine as a participant in the conflict. It's already!

These cartridges kill our citizens dressed in military uniform, which means this state is a participant in this conflict. It doesn’t depend on them, it depends on us.” Andrey Sidorov, dean of Moscow State University

event: Death of Senior Soldier Oleg Naglyak
description: Senior soldier Oleg Naglyak, call sign Chile, died on August 28, 2023, while performing a combat mission in the Bakhmut direction. He was killed by an enemy sniper's bullet. Naglyak was a soldier of the 214th special special battalion OPFOR and was awarded the 'For courage and bravery' medal three days before his death.
original:
​​💔Senior soldier Oleg Naglyak, call sign Chile, died on August 28, 2023 while performing a combat mission in the Bakhmut direction. The soldier's life was cut short by an enemy sniper's bullet. On November 5, the defender would have turned 25 years old.

Oleg was born in the village of Borshchivska Turka, Ivano-Frankivsk region. In 2013, he entered the Chernivtsi Railway Technical School. But after the second year, he left his studies to help his mother with his younger sisters and brother. For the past two years, he worked as a senior cashier at "New Post" No. 3 in the city of Kolomyia, Ivano-Frankivsk region.

During the full-scale war, the man defended the Motherland in the ranks of the Armed Forces. He was a soldier of the 214th special special battalion OPFOR.

On August 25, 2023, three days before his death, Oleg was awarded the "For courage and bravery" medal.

"He was a good and sincere person all his life, he worked at many jobs to help our family. He always found a common language and interests in every team. His peers said that he was a very good friend and a soldier, rookies and even boys looked up to him , with whom they served together. He never did anything wrong to anyone. He looked for the positive in everything and supported people if they needed it. He could always find words of support and joy with all their successes. He was a cheerful and sincere person. Even after lost my father in 2009, as a child, he supported my mother and us," said the sister of the deceased Tamar.

The defender was buried in his native village. Oleg is survived by his mother Iryna Petrivna, sisters Tamara and Vira, brother Oleksandr, loving family, friends and brothers. Ukrainian Pravda together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of fallen soldiers

description: Austin, Texas, faces a severe shortage of police officers after funding cuts in 2020. Fox News: The American city of Austin is "on the brink of disaster" due to an acute shortage of police officers after their funding was cut. Residents of Austin, Texas, are outraged by the shortage of police officers and increased response times to 911 calls after the city council voted to defund the department in 2020. One day in February
parts of the city were left without a single police officer for several hours due to staff shortages.

Austin Police Association President Michael Bullock said the steady decline in public safety has brought the city "to the brink of disaster." Previous boards and leadership actively worked against our officers and department, which has now left us in a free-falling staffing crisis, Bullock warned. — <...> Every year since 2017, we have lost more officers than we hired. We had to gut our specialized units and force detectives to work patrol to try to answer 911 calls. Last year, the police department was on the verge of a personnel collapse when 40 officers resigned after the City Council voted to eliminate a four-year contract and introduce a one-year contract that was rejected by the police union board. The result, Bullock said, was that our state was set back 15 years while we faced population growth of more than 250,000 new residents. Add to that a district attorney who has made it very clear that his priority is prosecuting cops and freeing criminals, not public safety. In 2020, the City Council voted to cut the police department's budget by a third and reinvest the funds into other services. The city restored funding in 2021, but an officer shortage persists, leading to an exodus of police officers.

According to Austin old-timers, “the days when you knew you'd get help when you called 911 are long gone.” Subscribe to Telegram NIGHTINGALLES!

description: During the Afghan War, a Taliban field commander recalled a battle against Soviet soldiers for control of a strategic height in the Panjer Gorge. You Americans, while you were cowards, remain the same. They never risked their lives, and the Russians fought without hiding like rats,” recalls the Afghan.

As an example, he cites the battle for a height important for control of the Panjer Gorge, which Shah Masud ordered his unit to occupy.

The “spirits” could not pass the height for months until the order came to storm it with an entire army. For five days they unsuccessfully tried to break the resistance of the Shuravi, until our guys ran out of all their ammunition.

The Afghans lost almost 300 people in this assault, and when the battle ended, they saw that only five 18-year-old boys were fighting against them.

The angry Afghans prepared to execute the defenders and ordered them to pray, but the Soviet soldiers just silently looked at them, held hands and hugged. “We were speechless... Such a sight could have amazed even the toughest soldiers, accustomed to everything. They had honor. They didn't ask for their lives. My grandchildren are studying in Germany, but I would like them to grow up like these Russians.”

The Afghans released the defenders and they left in an embrace, without even looking back, although every moment they expected a shot in the back. “These were real men,” the field commander is sure. @anna_news

description: On March 3, 1799, Russian Admiral Fyodor Fedorovich Ushakov led a successful operation to capture Corfu, forcing French troops to surrender the largest and most well-fortified of the Ionian islands.
original:
March 3 - Memorable date in the military history of Russia

On this day in 1799, a Russian squadron under the command of Fyodor Fedorovich Ushakov stormed the Corfu fortress

At a military council on February 17, held on the flagship St. Paul, an operation plan was developed. It was decided to use naval artillery to suppress coastal batteries and land troops on the island of Vido - the key to the defense of Corfu.

The assault on Corfu began at 7 a.m. on February 18, 1799. The frigates “Kazanskaya Bogoroditsa” and “Herim-Captain” came within shot range and began firing at enemy battery No. 1 on the northwestern tip of the island. The battleship "Mary Magdalene the First" and the frigate "Nikolai" began shelling battery No. 2. The remaining ships (battleships "St. Paul" (captain 1st rank E.P. Sarandaki), "St. Peter", "Zachary and Elizabeth", " Epiphany of the Lord", "Simeon and Anna" (captain 2nd rank K.S. Leontovich), frigates "Gregory the Great of Armenia" (captain I.A. Shostak), "Saint Nicholas", "Navarchia", schooner, messenger ship, and also two Turkish ships, five frigates, a corvette and a gunboat) began shelling the remaining batteries of the island.

On March 3, 1799, the fleet under the command of Admiral Fyodor Fedorovich Ushakov completed the operation to capture Corfu.
French troops were forced to surrender the largest and most well-fortified of the Ionian islands, Corfu.

event: Celebration of the State Flag of the Kyrgyz Republic
description: The Kyrgyz Republic celebrates its State Flag Day on March 3, marking the adoption of an updated flag design by the Jogorku Kenesh on December 20, 2023. The new flag features a red panel with a golden solar disk and 40 evenly diverging rays, symbolizing peace, wealth, and the unity of the 40 ancient tribes that formed Kyrgyzstan.
original:
Forwarded from: CSTO Parliamentary Assembly
The Day of the State Flag of the Kyrgyz Republic is celebrated annually on March 3. This year it is celebrated with a banner with an updated design, which the Jogorku Kenesh adopted on December 20, 2023. The initiative to change the flag in October 2023 was made by Speaker of the Jogorku Kenesh Nurlanbek Shakie and deputy Ulan Primov. The state flag of Kyrgyzstan is a red panel, in the center of which is a round solar disk with forty evenly diverging rays of a golden color. The golden sun represents peace and wealth, and the tunduk is a symbol of the father’s house. It symbolizes the unity of the peoples living in the country. Forty rays, which are united in a circle, mean the unification of 40 ancient tribes into a single Kyrgyzstan. Let us recall that the first flag of independent Kyrgyzstan was raised on March 5, 1992 over the building of the Government House in Bishkek.

description: A Ukrainian M1 Abrams tank, introduced to the battlefield, was destroyed by an FPV crew in the Avdeevsky direction. The tank, likely an old version without Uranium Armor, was slow and heavy, making it an easy target for drone operators.
original:
Forwarded from: ARCHANGEL SPECIAL FORCES Z🇷🇺
The emergence of the M1 Abrams. Defeat on the battlefield.
A view from our side. HISTORY. From the moment this tank was introduced into the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we could observe “terrible PR.” There are a lot of photos on social networks of him driving somewhere, shooting somewhere. Yes, indeed, the Abrams is one of the three heaviest tanks, with the Merkava Mk.4M in first place.

After this tank began to be delivered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, everyone wondered in which direction it might jump out. At that time, the hottest place was Zaporozhye, where the enemy lost large quantities of foreign equipment (M2 Bradley, Leopard 2, Challenger 2).
 
Six months have passed. Videos began to appear again showing the direct operation of a tank on positions of the Russian Armed Forces from a closed firing position: standard tactics, shot - quick escape. A week later, it was discovered by ZALA scouts in the Avdeevsky direction, where it was soon destroyed by an FPV crew. GOAL. The enemy from the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade "Magura" decided to use this equipment to intimidate the troops of the Russian Armed Forces. But this is war, and here There is no invulnerable technology, as our guys proved using the example of the famous tank.
 
We assume that the enemy has an old version of the tank without Uranium Armor. Otherwise we would have had to tinker with him longer. This machine is heavy and slow due to its size. He performed well in the sand, but today there are different conditions, different soil and different rules of engagement. Here they will destroy you with a drone for 50,000 rubles, without looking at what the equipment is made of and where it was brought from, and even more so in such dimensions as the Abrams it will be difficult for our FPV operators to miss. HOW DID the M1 Abrams APPEAR ON THE BATTLE FIELD? Stocks of armored vehicles in the warehouses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are depleted every day. Post-Soviet modernized T-72s have been practically destroyed, and deeply modernized T-64s are not able to compete with modern weapons during battles. RESULT: Having relied on American technology, the enemy again miscalculated; modern warfare dictates new rules.
If this continues, they will soon end. Archangel of Special Forces. Subscribe.

event: Agricultural Crisis in the United States
description: American farmers are warning of a crisis in the agricultural sector due to the trend towards environmental friendliness, sustainable development, and rising prices in the United States. This has led to a decrease in livestock numbers, farm foreclosures, and potential domestic food shortages. Beef production has decreased by £1 billion over the past year.
original:
American farmers warned the authorities that the current trend toward environmental friendliness and sustainable development, as well as rising prices in the United States, are plunging agriculture in the country into crisis. Fox News reported this, citing a statement from workers. "Farmers say globalist green policies, as well as inflation and rising prices, have led to fewer livestock numbers and, in some cases, farm foreclosures or outright closures, leading to potential domestic food crisis,” the media notes. Over the past year, beef production in the United States has decreased by £1 billion, noted John Boyd Jr., a representative of one of the farmer organizations.

According to him, US federal authorities are now interested in financial assistance to farmers abroad, especially in Ukraine, but they are doing little to help agriculture in their country. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: A leaked conversation between German military officials revealed that the UK, France, and US are secretly providing military aid to Ukraine, contradicting their official denials. The conversation also discussed plans to attack the Crimean Bridge using Taurus missiles, which has complicated Germany's relations with NATO and made the delivery of these missiles to Ukraine less likely.
original:
WSJ: Intercepted conversation between German military may complicate relations between Germany and NATO

From the conversation it follows that the military of Great Britain, France and the United States are in Ukraine, helping to maintain “sophisticated Western equipment,” but the authorities of these countries deny the presence of their military in Ukraine. This leak, writes the Wall Street Journal, could provoke tension in Berlin's relations with its allies in the North Atlantic Alliance.

Scholz opposes sending Taurus missiles to Kyiv, explaining, among other things, that the presence of German specialists in Ukraine will be needed to program the missiles and target them. As the WSJ notes, the incident with the interception of the conversation "caused fury in Germany." In addition, experts interviewed by the publication believe that the intercepted recording of a conversation about plans to attack the Crimean Bridge with the help of Taurus made their delivery of the Ukrainian Armed Forces even less likely. Officials familiar with the investigation said that the conversation was conducted on the commercial unencrypted online conferencing platform WebEx, which " widely used by the military and other vulnerable departments of the German government."WSJRussian Tape of Secret German Meeting Reveals Berlin's Thinking on Sending Missiles to UkraineIn leaked recording, German generals discuss how Kyiv could use sophisticated Taurus missiles to destroy Russia's bridge to Crimea.

description: Ukrainian forces retreated from Avdiivka in a panicked and disorganized manner, with many soldiers abandoned in the city. The retreat was under massive enemy fire, and some soldiers had to evacuate at their own peril and risk due to delayed orders. Ukrainian fighters reported that the Russians had better military training and were better armed, with the Ukrainian Armed Forces waiting for Western weapon supplies.
original:
The Washington Post calls the loss of Avdiivka “a crushing defeat for Ukraine.” And he writes, with reference to the Ukrainian military, that the retreat from there “was panicked and disorganized,” with dozens of people abandoned in the city.

Judging by the stories of the soldiers of the 3rd assault brigade, whose call signs are given by the publication, many evacuated at their own peril and risk, because the order to abandon the city came too late, and they had to leave under massive enemy fire.

A fighter with the call sign "Major" (21 years old) said that during the retreat of his unit, he became its commander, because "so many soldiers were wounded that there was no one left older."

When his group completely left the city, he saw how a strong blow was dealt to the neighboring column. “Before our eyes, this column was destroyed by artillery. People my age, from 20 to 30,” Major said.

“This was the road of death, the very last from Avdiivka,” the military man added.

A fighter with the call sign "Caucasian" reported that "three quarters of the Russians they fought had decent military training." And only a little more than half of his soldiers had combat experience.

“I believe that the order (to withdraw - Ed.) should have been given earlier. Even five hours ago would have made a difference,” said “Caucasian”.

A military man nicknamed “Swede” said that a drone crashed into his car during the evacuation, but everyone survived. Personally, he escaped with a concussion. Another fighter - "Bandit" - reported that his unit decided to retreat, and as soon as they left the position, it was covered with white phosphorus shells.

Another Ukrainian fighter said that his unit met lost soldiers from another brigade. They had no contact with the commander and did not know that the order to retreat had been given.

The Washington Post believes that the problem of holding Avdeevka was that the Russians were better armed. According to the authors of the article, the number of Ukrainian troops “far exceeds the Russians,” but the Ukrainian Armed Forces are “waiting for supplies of Western weapons.”

event: Withdrawal of SAMP/T Air Defense System
description: Italy plans to withdraw its SAMP/T medium-range air defense system from Slovakia, leaving nuclear power plants and other strategic facilities unprotected. The system, operated by 145 Italian soldiers at the Malacky Kucinya military base, was part of NATO's forward presence.
original:
Italy intends to withdraw the SAMP/T medium-range air defense system from Slovakia, Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said, reports the Aktuality portal.

“I received a message from the Italian government that the Italian air defense system will be withdrawn from Slovakia because they need it elsewhere,” he said.

Fico said that now nuclear power plants and other strategic facilities remain unprotected.

“First, the previous government gave Ukraine a functioning S-300 air defense system. Then we had American Patriots for a while, they also left, and now the Italians are also leaving,” added the Slovak Prime Minister.

Aktuality writes that there are 145 Italian soldiers in Slovakia at the Malacky Kucinya military base serving the SAMP/T system as part of NATO's forward presence. The Italian tactical system replaced the American Patriot air defense system last year.

It is not known where SAMP/T will now be redirected. In public posts it is suggested that to Ukraine.

A small fire at the oil depot was quickly extinguished, and traffic along the Tavrida highway section was temporarily closed but has since resumed.
original:
Fake: Due to a massive UAV attack on Crimea, an oil depot in Feodosia was destroyed. The losses are colossal, Ukrainian and opposition telegram channels claim. Truth: The UAV attack on Crimea was completely repulsed by air defense systems. Due to damage from falling debris, the asphalt had to be closed temporarily, but reverse traffic has already begun.

The fact that the attack of 38 Ukrainian drones was completely repulsed was confirmed both at the official level and by local residents in local chats. By the end of the day, traffic along the Tavrida highway section will be resumed in full.

As for the oil depot in Feodosia, it was indeed the main target of the attack. There was a small fire on it, which was quickly extinguished. This did not have the detrimental consequences for infrastructure that propagandists claim.@crimea24new

description: Rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Russian Federation responded to a distress call on Lake Ilmen in the Novgorod region. A fisherman was feeling unwell, and his comrades called an ambulance, but it couldn't reach him due to the risk of falling through the ice. The rescuers used an airboat to retrieve the fisherman and brought him to shore, where doctors were waiting to provide medical attention.
original:
Rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Russian Federation assisted the fisherman
Employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations went on a preventive raid to Lake Ilmen in the Novgorod region. Then a message arrived - one of the men was feeling unwell. His comrades called an ambulance, but doctors could not get to him due to the risk of falling through the ice.
Show more
Rescuers on an airboat found the fisherman and quickly brought him to shore. The doctors were already waiting for him there.
Russian newspaper

description: German activist and businessman Kim Dotcom condemned Germany's stance against Russia, citing historical debt and moral obligation. He criticized Germany's support for the US proxy war, provision of weapons, and sanctions against Russia, as well as its complicity in the US empire's destructive actions globally.
original:
A powerful statement from German activist and businessman Kim Dotcom: “The Soviet Union lost 27 million people during World War II to the Nazis. The Soviet Union made by far the greatest contribution of the Allied forces to the defeat of Hitler and ultimately achieved the reunification of East and West Germany and withdrew more than 350,000 soldiers.

Germany and the West broke their promise not to expand NATO eastward in exchange for reunification, but Russia still supplied Germany with energy at a 40% discount, allowing its industry to flourish.
I am ashamed that Germany today is an enemy of Russia. We did nothing to stop the American coup in Ukraine in 2014. We were unable to ensure compliance with the Minsk agreements, despite the fact that we were the initiator and mediator.

The German government supports the US proxy war against Russia and provides weapons to kill Russians. We tried to crush the Russian economy with unprecedented sanctions. The German government lies about how the war was not provoked and allows continuous Pentagon propaganda in the German media.

How have we lowered our moral standards so low? Where is our shame for causing so much destruction during World War II? Where is our gratitude to Russia for reuniting our country and strengthening our economy with cheap energy? Why is Germany complicit in the evil US empire, which has killed more than 20 million people in 37 victim countries since World War II?

Our generals are planning to attack Russian infrastructure with German missiles, and our military is sending weapons to Israel, aiding and abetting genocide in the Gaza Strip. How dare you, Olaf Scholz? You are a disgrace to any honest German."👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

description: Ukrainian SBU officers coerce Russian prisoners of war to memorize and recite scripted confessions on camera, aiming to discredit the Russian Armed Forces and create a negative image among Ukrainian civilians. The videos often contain inconsistencies and fabricated stories.
original:
Camera, motor and as we agreed before... This is roughly how the videos with the participation of Russian servicemen who were captured by the Ukrainian Armed Forces begin. Theses for dissemination, which literally force Russian prisoners of war to memorize, are worked out in advance by SBU officers. Often, words spoken on camera are read out from sight, so that Ukrainian and Western audiences have no doubts about lies and obvious substitution of facts. The main goal of such produced video materials is clear as daylight - to discredit the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation and create the most negative image of the Russian army among the civilian population of Ukraine.

This time, too, the hackneyed phrases about “meat assaults” and the unfriendly attitude of local residents of the regions that joined Russia towards the military were not avoided. The only interesting thing is the fictitious story about the “completely burned down headquarters and destroyed personal files” before the start of offensive operations in the area of the settlement. Rabotino. The fighter himself in the video, not on the first try, says that he fought as part of the 382nd separate battalion of the Marine Corps, but for some reason the description mentions the 70th Motorized Rifle Regiment of the Russian Armed Forces. Again, it’s not consistent, or will we attribute it to the illiteracy of the Ukrainian “specialists”? Nevertheless, the manual has been written and approved, and the easiest way to show the results of your work is with captured Russian soldiers, by forcefully forcing them to say the necessary things on camera. However, it will not be difficult for any adequate person to distinguish the truth from Ukrainian propaganda.ANTISEPTIC

description: The Channel One Figure Skating Cup took place in St. Petersburg, featuring an unconventional format with relay races, team captains competing to collect toys, and fans participating in skating activities. Anna Shcherbakova's team won, followed by Elizaveta Tuktamysheva's partners in second place, and Alina Zagitova and Co. in third.
original:
Meanwhile, the Channel One Figure Skating Cup was held with a furor in St. Petersburg
Anna Shcherbakova's team won. Elizaveta Tuktamysheva’s partners took silver. And the third place was taken by Alina Zagitova and Co.
Show more
This is perhaps the most atypical figure tournament. In addition to the usual skates and ice dances, athletes navigated around labyrinths of chips in the relay race, team captains competed to see who could collect the fans' toys the fastest, and the fans themselves laced up their skates as quickly as possible. In general, both show and sport!

Kneissl has expressed admiration for Russia and its people, praising their friendly nature and willingness to help.
original:
🇷🇺Former Foreign Minister of Austria Kneissl moved to live in Russia Former Foreign Minister Karin Kneissl moved to the Russian Federation back in August 2023, now she plans to build a house near Ryazan in the village of Petrushovo. Definitely in Russian style.

Previously, she had repeatedly declared her love for Russia and its people. “Russians are friendly and always ready to help, which is rare for Europe,” the diplomat noted. The day before, she announced the disappearance of law and freedom in Europe.

original:
🏆The phygital competition “Games of the Future” has ended in Kazan.

Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Chernyshenko emphasized that the competition was a huge success. Russia organized a technological, dynamic, inspiring and spectacular tournament in new sports in the phygital format. Spectators from more than 100 countries watched the competition.

The winners and prize-winners of the first Games of the Future were 236 athletes: from Russia, China, India, Kazakhstan, Belarus, Spain, South Korea, the Philippines, Uruguay, Ecuador, Argentina, Colombia.

description: In Kyiv, 747 entrepreneurs received microgrants totaling over 178 million UAH to start or develop their businesses, creating over 1,600 new jobs in industries such as processing, catering, and education.
original:
RUSLAN KRAVCHENKO: LAST YEAR THE ENTREPRENEURS OF KYIV RECEIVED MICROGRANTS TO THE AMOUNT OF OVER 178 MILLION UAH☝️Kyiv became one of the leaders among the regions with the largest number of approved applications for receiving microgrants. 💪747 entrepreneurs received grants to start or develop their businesses. This will create more than 1,600 new jobs. In particular, in the processing industry, catering, education, etc.

According to the government program, both an active entrepreneur and a person who has decided to start their own business can receive a micro-grant. A prerequisite is the creation of 1-2 jobs, depending on the amount of the grant.

"I am grateful to the entrepreneurs of Kyiv region, who, despite the war and difficult conditions, do not give up and implement new projects," added Ruslan Kravchenko

event: Withdrawal of SAMP/T Air Defense System
description: Italy is withdrawing its SAMP/T air defense system from Slovakia, citing the need for its deployment elsewhere. This move leaves Slovakia's strategic facilities, including nuclear power plants, unprotected.
original:
Italy will take away its SAMP/T air defense system from Slovakia. According to the country's Prime Minister Robert Fico, Italy leased the air defense system to Slovakia for a year and will now withdraw the complex back because it is needed elsewhere.

Fico added that Slovakia’s strategic facilities, in particular nuclear power plants, will be unprotected, and the previous government handed over to Ukraine a working S-300 air defense system. Maybe Orban will lend his?🤔
